result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew M Schilz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit. Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time. STAYED. To be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Probation revoked, sentence imposed.

Defendant Andrew M Schilz in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   James E. Fitzgerald and Leslie Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes sentencing recommendations.  Defense makes sentencing recommendation.  Defendant makes statements.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:
Sentencing After Revocation:
Count 1 
JAIL - 9 MONTHS (credit 288 days)
Sentence to run concurrent with 15CF177
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 20, 2017 at 10:30 am.

State requests the the sentencing hearing on revocation be adjourned with other cases pending PSI.  Court grants.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for October 20, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Sentencing on January 8, 2016
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 2, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for August 2, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 5, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 27, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: treatment letter from Lake County Wellness filed by Attorney Kershek-dated 11/19/15

Defendant Andrew M Schilz in court with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS    **CONCURRENT WITH CASE #15CF177**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done

BUY MONEY:  $175.00 to Metro Drug Unit   (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  90 Days jail, (Straight time) - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
 
***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations***
Sentencing hearing at 01-08-2016 03:00 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Attorney Kershek requests a sentencing date.    Bail remains as fixed.
